channel.title: Golang on Michael Knapp's Home Page
channel.description: Recent content in Golang on Michael Knapp's Home Page

item.title: Golang Concurrency
item.description: Summary Notes use “go” keyword to make a function run in parallel. When main completes, it will not wait for other goroutines to finish, the program stops. channels allow communication between goroutines. make(chan [, capacity]) Also just declaring a channel makes it. make(chan ) by default, it is bi-directional, and blocking. Sending to a channel will suspend the current goroutine until something reads from the channel. these are also called “unbuffered” or “synchronous” channels.

item.title: VSCode Shortcuts
item.description: Fatal Hotkeys Do not press: ctrl+alt+f10 - caused the screen to go blank and was unrecoverable. super+l - locks the screen. ctrl+q - closes vscode ctrl+w - closes the current editor tab alt f4 - closes the current vscode window. command pallette: f1, or ctrl+shift+p view shortcut keys: ctrl + k then s delete line: ctrl+shift+k
